item.title: Doug add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The people cannot be all, and always, well informed. The part which is wrong will be discontented, in proportion to the importance of the facts they misconceive. If they remain quiet under such misconceptions, it is lethargy, the forerunner of death to the public liberty. ... What country before ever existed a century and half without a rebellion? And what country can preserve its liberties if their rulers are not warned from time to time that their people preserve the spirit of resistance? Let them take arms. The remedy is to set them right as to facts, pardon and pacify them. What signify a few lives lost in a century or two? The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants. It is its natural manure." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Doug add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Congressmen who willfully take action during wartime that damages morale and undermine the military are saboteurs and should be arrested, exiled, or hung" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Doug add a quote by Albert Pike
item.description: "What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal." -- Albert Pike

item.title: Doug add a quote by George S. Patton Jr.
item.description: "The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other guy die for his." -- George S. Patton Jr.

item.title: Doug add a quote by Stephen Ambrose
item.description: "When Hitler declared war on the United States, he was betting that German soldiers, raised up in the Hitler Youth, would always out fight American soldiers, brought up in the Boy Scouts. He lost that bet. The Boy Scouts had been taught how to figure their way out of their own problems." -- Stephen Ambrose

item.title: Doug add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write ." -- John Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Never question another man's motive. His wisdom, yes, but not his motives." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Doug add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Never send a battalion to take a hill if a regiment is available." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Doug add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Extremes to the right and to the left of any political dispute are always wrong." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Doug add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Doug add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Doug add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Doug add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "One would go mad if one took the Bible seriously; but to take it seriously one must be already mad." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Doug add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Doug add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "From this day to the ending of the world, But we in it shall be remembered- We few, we happy few, we band of brothers; For he to-day that sheds his blood with me Shall be my brother; be he ne’er so vile, This day shall gentle his condition; And gentlemen in England now-a-bed Shall think themselves accurs’d they were not here, And hold their manhoods cheap whiles any speaks That fought with us upon Saint Crispin’s day." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet. Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Doug add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Epicurus's old questions are still unanswered: Is he (God) willing to prevent evil, but not able? then he is impotent. Is he able, but not willing? then he is malevolent. Is he both able and willing? then whence evil?" -- David Hume

item.title: Doug add a quote by Lewis Black
item.description: "Who knew that the devil had a factory where he made millions of fossils, which his minions distributed throughout the earth, in order to confuse my tiny brain?" -- Lewis Black

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I find the whole business of religion profoundly interesting. But it does mystify me that otherwise intelligent people take it seriously." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "Our youth now love luxury. They have bad manners, contempt for authority; they show disrespect for their elders and love chatter in place of exercise; they no longer rise when elders enter the room; they contradict their parents, chatter before company; gobble up their food and tyrannize their teachers." -- Socrates

item.title: Doug add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world." -- Bill Watterson
